column4: How do I force X to use the PreferredMode on one of my dual-head displays? (Radeon 8500, Ubuntu 7.10)
Why isn't X using the preferred resolution reported by my monitor?
not defined in your xorg.conf file?
defining it in xorg.conf doesn't help
it's the preferred mode to begin with, so why wouldn't X use it?
maybe not right refresh rate, etc. so it fails over to next mode?
no, I can switch to the preferred mode with Xrandr no problem, even using --auto
can you switch to that res. using the ctrl+alt and plus/minus keys?
X just doesn't want to start with that mode for some reason

need some quick help... recently got a new machine, moved my ubuntu hd to it and everything works except sound... sound works fine on the new box with the live cd, how can i get the system to reconfigure the sound?
a common problem seems to be ALSA using the wrong sound card, like the internal one
this is the internal card... same basic chipset as the old one (intel 8x0) but old machine was a Dell GX270 and new box is a kick butt HP workstation
think i'll just boot the live cd and see what modules are loaded
maybe it's looking for a card in the wrong PCI slot?
